macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: S&P 500 Hits Record High Amid Mixed Index Performance
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose 0.4% to 6,978.60, setting a fresh all-time intraday high led by Technology stocks, while the Dow Jones fell 0.8% to 49,003.41 and Nasdaq gained 0.9% to 23,817.10 on January 27, 2026.

items.title: Wall Street Zigzags on Mixed Earnings from UnitedHealth, GM, and Tech Giants
items.summary: Stocks showed mixed results with gains in Apple, Microsoft, and GM offsetting sharp drops in UnitedHealth and insurers; investor sentiment remained bullish with a put-call ratio of 0.74.

items.title: Consumer Confidence Sours as Treasury Yields Hold Steady
items.summary: A report indicated sharply declining U.S. consumer confidence, but Treasury yields remained relatively steady amid ongoing market volatility and positioning for tech earnings.

items.title: Market Outlook Highlights AI Tailwinds, Caterpillar Signal, and Dollar Weakness
items.summary: Upcoming economic data points to manufacturing and AI tailwinds, with Caterpillar as a bellwether; emerging markets show leadership amid US dollar weakness and yen strength risks.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Surpasses $89,000 USDT with 0.23% 24-Hour Gain
items.summary: Bitcoin crossed the 89,000 USDT mark, trading at 89,014.25 USDT as of early January 28 UTC, marking a 0.23% increase over the past 24 hours amid cautious market sentiment.

items.title: 19,810 BTC Worth $580 Million Moved to New Address
items.summary: Blockchain data shows a massive transfer of 19,810.67 BTC, valued at approximately $580 million, to a new address, highlighting significant on-chain activity.

items.title: Crypto Markets Cautious as Bitcoin Nears $89,000 and Ethereum Eyes $3,000
items.summary: Markets opened the week cautiously with Bitcoin approaching $89,000 and Ethereum nearing $3,000, reflecting tempered optimism in major cryptocurrencies.

items.title: 4 in 10 U.S. Merchants Now Accept Cryptocurrency Payments
items.summary: New research reveals cryptocurrency payments are going mainstream, with 40% of U.S. merchants accepting digital assets, boosting crypto adoption in commerce.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: OIST Researchers Develop AI That Learns Better Through Self-Talk
items.summary: Scientists at the Okinawa Institute of Science and Technology (OIST) have created an AI system that improves learning and generalization by incorporating inner speech and working memory, enabling better multitasking and adaptation with sparse data.

items.title: AI Agents Build Complete Deep Learning System VIBETENSOR
items.summary: Researchers from NVIDIA and others have demonstrated VIBETENSOR, a fully AI-generated deep learning software stack including tensor systems and CUDA runtime, marking a milestone in AI-assisted software engineering.

items.title: UNC Study Reveals Predictive AI Boosts Customer Satisfaction in Chatbots
items.summary: Kenan-Flagler Business School researcher Yuqian Xu's study shows that AI agents predicting customer inquiries, like specific package details, increase satisfaction by 6.4%, reduce call times by 7.7%, and lower human transfers.

items.title: Education in Motion Launches Group-Wide AI in Education Initiative
items.summary: Education in Motion announced a comprehensive AI program featuring scalable frameworks, school research pilots, teacher resources, and ethical governance to integrate AI with academic rigor.

items.title: Senior Expert Advocates for Lifelong Learning in AI
items.summary: In an Xinhua interview, a senior AI expert emphasizes the need for AI systems to incorporate lifelong learning capabilities to adapt continuously.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Highguard Peaks at 97K Concurrent Players but Faces Mostly Negative Reactions
items.summary: The controversial new video game Highguard launched with a peak of 97,000 concurrent players but has received mostly negative reactions from players.[1]

items.title: OpenBet and Sportradar Exit American Gaming Association Over Prediction Markets Dispute
items.summary: OpenBet and Sportradar have left the AGA, joining DraftKings, FanDuel, and Fanatics amid disagreements on prediction markets, marking five major exits in three months.[2]

items.title: Mobile Legends: Bang Bang Announces Five-Region Esports Overhaul and M7 World Championship
items.summary: Mobile Legends: Bang Bang is expanding globally with a five-region esports restructuring and the M7 World Championship breaking ground in Turkiye and Thailand.[3]

items.title: Nintendo Reveals Virtual Boy Games Lineup for Nintendo Classics in 2026
items.summary: Nintendo announced additions to its Nintendo Classics Virtual Boy lineup later in 2026, including Mario Clash, Mario Tennis, Jack Bros., and Space Invaders Virtual.[4]

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
